cards.desc:
I want to find out:

- whether the site is a reliable source of medical advice
- the limitations of the data set (pull from FDA API's disclaimer)
- how the site is using or storing my personal information
- The licensing requirements of our open-source tools

Put a link from any page on the site (i.e. somewhere on the header, footer, or sidebar) to a separate page containing this information.

*About SHIELD*
S.H.I.E.L.D. (Search for Help in the Electronic Label Database) is a freely available, online tool to help people find over-the-counter medication that suits their needs. This site was developed by [Pyramid Systems, Inc.](http://www.psi-it.com) in support of the GSA ADS RFQ.

*Legal Disclaimer*
This site is not designed to and does not provide medical advice or professional diagnosis to you or to any other individual. SHIELD provides general information for educational purposes only. If you believe you have a health problem of any kind, or if you have any questions regarding your health or a medical condition, promptly consult your physician or other healthcare provider.

*Data Accuracy*
SHIELD uses data from the openFDA API based on the FDA's electronic database of drug labels. openFDA is a beta research project and not for clinical use. While we make every effort to ensure that data is accurate, you should assume all results are unvalidated. Neither this site nor the FDA ensure or warrant the efficacy or safety of medication available "over-the-counter".

*Privacy Policy*
This site does not store any personally identifiable or sensitive information. Searches performed on this site are not stored for future use, nor is any identifying information collected and used via cookies.

*Licensing Information*
- [openFDA License](https://open.fda.gov/license/)
- Add additional licensing information related to the technology stack.
cards.name: I want to read a legal disclaimer about the site and its contents

Display Rules:

- Each field should be on its own line, within the sections (see wireframes for details). Wrap long fields.
- If a category has no associated fields, show the header and "N/A".

cards.desc:
Show a basic count of the number of distinct purposes in the FDA label database matching the user's purpose search term.

*Wording:* "[#] matching purposes"

*Data:* 

- Show one match for each distinct word or phrase starting with the user's search term. For example, a search of "relie" could mean either "relief", "relieves", or "reliever".
- Limit to OTC drugs. 
- [Sample query](https://api.fda.gov/drug/label.json?search=product_type:otc+AND+purpose:[relie+TO+reliezzz])
cards.name: I want to know how many purposes are similar to mine so that I can ensure I entered the purpose correctly

cards.desc:
As a user types their purpose, show a list of suggested matches in the FDA label database for that value in the purpose field of OTC products.

*Wording:*

- Show 25 characters on either side of the match, if available, plus the next word boundary if the 25th character is inside a word.
- Show up to 5 results in a drop-down beneath the search field.
- Treat the search term as a partial search, matching any words that begin with the term entered.
- If a single product mentions the search term multiple times, show the first match.
- If there are 0 results, show "No matches found."

*Data:*

- Limit to OTC drugs
- [Sample Query](https://api.fda.gov/drug/label.json?search=product_type:otc+AND+purpose:[pain+TO+painz]+AND+[relie+TO+reliez])
cards.name: I want to enter a purpose as text, including partial searches, so that I can find a specific set of products quickly

cards.desc:
Show a basic count of the number of distinct ingredients in the FDA label database which start with the user's search term as either an active or inactive ingredient.

*Wording:* "[#] matching ingredients"

*Data:* 

- Show the count of distinct words/phrases starting with the word/phrase entered. For instance, "aceta" could mean either "acetate" or "acetaminophen".
- Limit to OTC drugs. 
- [Sample query](https://api.fda.gov/drug/label.json?search=product_type:otc+AND+inactive_ingredient:[aloe+TO+aloezzz])
- Search is case-insensitive.
cards.name: I want to know how many ingredients are similar to mine so that I can ensure I spelled the ingredient correctly

card.desc:
New About blurb: "SHIELD (Search for Help in the Electronic Label Database) lets you find over-the-counter medication that's right for you. Find a drug that fits your problem, without any of the ingredients you want to avoid. Using SHIELD, you can quickly and easily check drug labels to make sure they meet your needs.

"SHIELD was created by [Pyramid Systems](http://www.psi-it.com) for the GSA's [Agile Delivery Services BPA](https://pages.18f.gov/ads-bpa/). It was created using free, public technologies."

New Licensing Information blurb: "The data for the products used on this website comes from [openFDA](https://open.fda.gov). Use of this data is generally unrestricted, but is subject to the [openFDA License](https://open.fda.gov/license/)."

Remove "Technologies used include:" this information is in the readme.

*About SHIELD*
S.H.I.E.L.D. (Search for Help in the Electronic Label Database) is a freely available, online tool to help people find over-the-counter medication that suits their needs. This site was developed by [Pyramid Systems, Inc.](http://www.psi-it.com) in support of the GSA ADS RFQ.

*Legal Disclaimer*
This site is not designed to and does not provide medical advice or professional diagnosis to you or to any other individual. SHIELD provides general information for educational purposes only. If you believe you have a health problem of any kind, or if you have any questions regarding your health or a medical condition, promptly consult your physician or other healthcare provider.

*Data Accuracy*
SHIELD uses data from the openFDA API based on the FDA's electronic database of drug labels. openFDA is a beta research project and not for clinical use. While we make every effort to ensure that data is accurate, you should assume all results are unvalidated. Neither this site nor the FDA ensure or warrant the efficacy or safety of medication available "over-the-counter".

*Privacy Policy*
This site does not store any personally identifiable or sensitive information. Searches performed on this site are not stored for future use, nor is any identifying information collected and used via cookies.

*Licensing Information*
- [openFDA License](https://open.fda.gov/license/)
- Add additional licensing information related to the technology stack.

If you believe you have a health problem of any kind, or if you have any questions regarding your health or a medical condition, promptly consult your physician or other healthcare provider.

*Data Accuracy*
SHIELD uses data from the openFDA API based on the FDA's electronic database of drug labels. openFDA is a beta research project and not for clinical use. While we make every effort to ensure that data is accurate, you should assume all results are unvalidated. Neither this site nor the FDA ensure or warrant the efficacy or safety of medication available "over-the-counter".

*Privacy Policy*
This site does not store any personally identifiable or sensitive information. Searches performed on this site are not stored for future use, nor is any identifying information collected and used via cookies.

card.desc:
Show the following information about a specific product (by id, based on the search results from a list of products):

Fields:

- *Unlabeled top section* (white background)
>- Product Name: (brand_name)
>- Manufacturer: (manufacturer_name)
>- Effective Date: (effective_time)
>- Purpose: (purpose)
>- Type: (product_type) - (route)
- Ingredients (grey background, color #e3e4e5, in 2 columns) 
>- Active Ingredients: (active_ingredient)
>- Inactive Ingredients: (inactive_ingredient)
- Warnings (white background)
>- (warnings,warnings_and_cautions, keep_out_of_reach_of_children, do_not_use, stop_use, overdosage, adverse_reactions, drug_interactions)
>- Other Interactions:
>>- Ask Doctor/Pharamacist(ask_doctor, ask_doctor_or_pharmacist)
>>- Pregnancy or Breastfeeding (pregnancy_or_breast_feeding)
>>- Other Safety Instructions (other_safety_interactions)
- Instructions for Use (grey background)
>- (instructions_for_use, dosage_and_administration, storage_and_handling, when_using, indications_and_usage)

Display Rules:

- Each field should be on its own line, within the sections (see wireframes for details). Wrap long fields.
- If a category has no associated fields, show the header and "N/A".

Add a Back button to return to the previous search results.

card.name: I want to see a list of products for my purpose(s) without my selected ingredient(s), so that I can find an alternative product that works for me
card.desc:
Show a list of products matching the user's search criteria in a table.

- Add a "View Results" button at the bottom of the purpose/ingredients search page, along with a count of matching products.
- Search button should be enabled only if there are results.
- If the user entered a purpose and ingredient(s), find products matching that purpose but not matching the ingredient(s).
- [Sample Query](https://api.fda.gov/drug/label.json?search=product_type:otc+AND+(generic_name:TRIETHYLHEXANOIN+inactive_ingredient:TRIETHYLHEXANOIN)+AND+purpose:sunscreen&limit=100&skip=0)
- Show 100 results.
- Fields to display:
>- Product Name (brand_name)
>- Purpose (purpose)
>- Manufacturer (manufacturer_name)
>- Active Ingredients (generic_name)
- Add a link/button (see wireframes) to go back to the search page, without losing the user's entered search terms.

card.desc:
Show the following information about a specific product (by id, based on the search results from a list of products):

Fields:

- Product Name: (brand_name)
- Manufacturer: (manufacturer_name)
- Purpose: (purpose)
- Type: (product_type) - (route)
- Effective Date (effective_time)
- Active Ingredients: (active_ingredient)
- Inactive Ingredients: (inactive_ingredient)
- Instructions for Use: (instructions_for_use, dosage_and_administration, storage_and_handling, when_using, indications_and_usage)
- Warnings: (warnings,warnings_and_cautions, keep_out_of_reach_of_children, do_not_use, stop_use, overdosage, adverse_reactions, drug_interactions)
- Other Interactions: (ask_doctor, ask_doctor_or_pharmacist, pregnancy_or_breast_feeding)

Display Rules:

- If a category has more than one associated field, separate each field by line breaks.
- If a category has no associated fields, show the header and "N/A".
- Wrap long fields in their own paragraph.

card.desc:
Clean up query results to make them presentable to the end user.

*Data Cleanup:*
- Turn the generic_name and manufacturer_name fields into Camel Case instead of upper case
- Remove junk labels from the contents of the purpose field, in any form
>- purpose*
>- use*
>- indication*
- Remove spacing characters (repeated dots, white space, underscores, bullets )

*Results Page Cleanup:*
- Instead of showing a horizontal scroll bar, remove the Active Ingredients / generic_name column from the search results if there isn't enough space
- Omit the total # of rows displayed and row numbers
- Change the top label to read "Search Results" instead of "Product Search"
- Add a link in the top label to return to the previous search page, while retaining the user's search terms

old.desc:
Clean up query results to make them presentable to the end user.

>- Fields to filter: purpose, generic_name, inactive_ingredient, manufacturer_name, brand_name
- Add line breaks before each instance of a bullet character ()

Auto-suggest active or inactive ingredients from the user's ingredients search term, based on products containing that ingredient.

- Search both active and inactive ingredients (generic_name or inactive_ingredient columns)

card.desc:
Show a basic count of the number of distinct ingredients in the FDA label database which start with the user's search term as either an active or inactive ingredient.

*Wording:* "[#] matching ingredients"

*Data:* 

- Show the count of distinct words/phrases starting with the word/phrase entered. For instance, "aceta" could mean either "acetate" or "acetaminophen".
- Limit to OTC drugs. 
- [Sample query](https://api.fda.gov/drug/label.json?search=product_type:otc+AND+inactive_ingredient:[aloe+TO+aloezzz])
- Search is case-insensitive.

card.desc:
Show a basic count of the number of distinct purposes in the FDA label database matching the user's purpose search term.

*Wording:* "[#] matching purposes"

*Data:* 

- Show one match for each distinct word or phrase starting with the user's search term. For example, a search of "relie" could mean either "relief", "relieves", or "reliever".
- Limit to OTC drugs. 
- [Sample query](https://api.fda.gov/drug/label.json?search=product_type:otc+AND+purpose:[relie+TO+reliezzz])

old.desc:
Show a basic count of the number of products which list the user's search term as part of their purpose.

*Wording:*

- If any results are found: "Found [#] products for this purpose."
- If no results are found: "No products were found for this purpose. Choose a different search term and try again."

*Data:* 

- Show the meta.total field from a query on the purpose field.
- Limit to OTC drugs. 
- [Sample query](https://api.fda.gov/drug/label.json?search=product_type:otc+AND+purpose:expectorant)

card.name: I want to see a list of products for my purpose(s) without my selected ingredient(s), so that I can find an alternative product that works for me
card.desc:
Show a list of products matching the user's search criteria in a table.

- If the user entered a purpose and ingredient(s), find products matching that purpose but not matching the ingredient(s).
- Show 10 products per page, with paging options to see the next/previous 10 products, and the total number of results (meta.total field).
- If there are no results for a search, display "No products found for that purpose without those ingredients." and give a link back to the search page.
- [Sample Query](https://api.fda.gov/drug/label.json?search=product_type:otc+AND+(generic_name:TRIETHYLHEXANOIN+inactive_ingredient:TRIETHYLHEXANOIN)+AND+purpose:sunscreen&limit=10&skip=0)
- Fields to display:
>- Product Name (brand_name)
>- Purpose (purpose)
>- Manufacturer (manufacturer_name)
>- Active Ingredients (generic_name)
- Add a link/button (see wireframes) to go back to the search page, without losing the user's entered search terms.

- Fields to display:

Fields:

- Product Name: (brand_name)
- Manufacturer: (manufacturer_name)
- Purpose: (purpose)
- Type: (product_type) - (route)
- Effective Date: (
- Active Ingredients: (active_ingredient)
- Inactive Ingredients: (inactive_ingredient)
- Instructions for Use: (instructions_for_use, dosage_and_administration, storage_and_handling, when_using, indications_and_usage)
- Warnings (warnings,warnings_and_cautions, keep_out_of_reach_of_children, do_not_use, stop_use, overdosage, adverse_reactions, drug_interactions)
- Interactions (ask_doctor, ask_doctor_or_pharmacist, pregnancy_or_breast_feeding)

Display Rules:

- If a category has more than one associated field, separate each field by line breaks.
- If a category has no associated fields, show the header and "N/A".

card.desc:
Show a list of products matching the user's search criteria in a table.

- If the user entered a purpose and ingredient(s), find products matching that purpose but not matching the ingredient(s).
- Show 10 products per page, with paging options to see the next/previous 10 products, and the total number of results (meta.total field).
- If there are no results for a search, display "No products found for that purpose without those ingredients." and give a link back to the search page.
- [Sample Query](https://api.fda.gov/drug/label.json?search=product_type:otc+AND+(generic_name:TRIETHYLHEXANOIN+inactive_ingredient:TRIETHYLHEXANOIN)+AND+purpose:sunscreen&limit=10&skip=0)
- Fields to display:
>- Product Name (brand_name)
>- Purpose (purpose)
>- Manufacturer (manufacturer_name)
>- Active Ingredients (generic_name)
>- Inactive Ingredients (inactive_ingredient)
- Add a link/button (see wireframes) to go back to the search page, without losing the user's entered search terms.

card.desc:
Auto-suggest active or inactive ingredients from the user's ingredients search term, based on products containing that ingredient.

- Search either active or inactive ingredients (generic_name or inactive_ingredient columns)
- Show the first 5 matching items
- Show 25 characters plus the next word boundary on either side of the match in the field
- Limit search to OTC medications (product_type:otc)
- If no results were found for a search term, show "No results found."
- [Sample Query](https://api.fda.gov/drug/label.json?search=product_type:otc+AND+(active_ingredient:[oxyben+TO+oxybenzzz]+inactive_ingredient:[oxyben+TO+oxybenzzz]))

card.desc:
As a user types their purpose, show a list of suggested matches in the FDA label database for that value in the purpose field of OTC products.

*Wording:*

- Show 25 characters on either side of the match, if available, plus the next word boundary if the 25th character is inside a word.
- Show up to 5 results in a drop-down beneath the search field.
- Treat the search term as a partial search, matching any words that begin with the term entered.
- If a single product mentions the search term multiple times, show the first match.
- If there are 0 results, show "No matches found."

*Data:*

- Limit to OTC drugs
- [Sample Query](https://api.fda.gov/drug/label.json?search=product_type:otc+AND+purpose:[pain+TO+painz]+AND+[relie+TO+reliez])

Show a basic count of the number of products which list the user's search term as either an active or inactive ingredient, from two separate searches.

*Wording:*

- If any results are found: "Found in [#] products as an active ingredient, and in [#] products as an inactive ingredient."
- If no results are found: "This is not listed as an ingredient. Choose a different search term and try again."

*Data:* 

- Show the meta.total field from a query on the active_ingredient and inactive_ingredient fields.
- Limit to OTC drugs. 
- [Sample query](https://api.fda.gov/drug/label.json?search=product_type:otc+AND+inactive_ingredient:aloe)

Clean up query results
card.desc:
Clean up query results to make them presentable to the end user.

- Apply a consistent case to each field
- Remove the name of the field from the contents of the field, in both singular and plural forms
- Remove common helper words from COUNT queries: "and", "or", "the", "for", "of"
- Replace spacing elements like bullet points or "....."
(- Add line breaks after each instance of repeated content)

More stuff TBD as we find it

Research using AngularJS and Bootstrap together
card.desc:
I'm familiar with Bootstrap and wanted to use it to help me put together the front-end (mobile support, components, icons, etc.). However, I think there are complications when using it with AngularJS. Can someone help me investigate using them together?

Some potentially helpful links:

Using AngularJS & Bootstrap together: https://scotch.io/tutorials/how-to-correctly-use-bootstrapjs-and-angularjs-together

http://www.w3schools.com/angular/angular_bootstrap.asp

Angular UI: http://angular-ui.github.io/bootstrap/
